website_summaries.verdict: A classic design that also stands up to the test of time.
pros: We love that this 18-inch fan comes fully assembled
Well-regarded as a fan that helps with sleep
A favorite of those in small spaces
cons: Loyal customers of the brand suggest the power could be better

customer_reviews.title: Works on our patio!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Texas and it's virtually impossible to spend time outside without heatstroke. But we love our pergola-patio, which has tree cover, but is still stifling. Our friend owns an outside bar and suggested these. We hang these from the posts of our pergola, slanted down toward our patio furniture. The airflow is powerful and they hold up under rain & strong wind. They provide enough breeze that we can actually have parties outside! (as long as we stay on the patio) And if one stops working (which has happened once in 2 years), they are relatively cheap enough to replace--unlike the expensive wet-rated fans
customer_reviews.author: lakehouse214

customer_reviews.title: Very upset loyal customer!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this item 4 months and it has stop working it was very nice and gets my room very cold like an ac but it woke me up on April 2 not working I thought it was my outlet so I tried another one and still nothing I'm very dissatisfied because I paid$86 for it and didn't have it 6 months so I'm very upset about it.How can I get another one?
customer_reviews.author: AQUIANIA

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried ordering this fan because on some reviews people were complaining about how loud this fan was, but to be honest, it's not too bad. I'm happy with how much air is circulated, however, I am very disappointed that the fan does not stay in a down position. You can adjust the fan to blow up or down, and when I put it down, or even straight a head it just moves to the up position. All in all, I might be returning this fan. If I can't place it the way I like it, then it's just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Be careful - possible electrical charge.
customer_reviews.text: First time use I got an electrical shock when I touched the cage of the fan to adjust it while it was running. I tried it twice and twice I got a bump of electricity. I asked someone knowledgeable regarding grounding an electric motor and he said perhaps the brushes needed to be burned in or otherwise they inadvertently grounded it to the cage somehow, I have been reluctant to try again. I will try again this week and if the same electric shock occurs, I will return it. The floor, hands or feet were not wet. I was barefoot at the time but that should not have mattered.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Waller

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until I hated it because it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I loved this fan until I hated it because it stopped working one day for no reason 2 months after I bought it. Apparently product support is finished although it seems like there should be some sort of warranty. I called the company and they have promised to send me a replacement fan several times but keep telling me it's out of stock. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M. Shuster

customer_reviews.title: Chinese  Made
customer_reviews.text: Well it is an American name I've had I have had 5 Chinese fans at burnout I had an American Patton the lasted 22 years that's why I gave It a one star if it Burns out like a water rested from Albert you know but the American fans made in America where a 100% better $20 for Patton fan years ago last me 22 years and that's the truth
customer_reviews.author: dave winters

customer_reviews.title: Good high velocity fan
customer_reviews.text: Good high velocity fan. It moves a lot of air. Great for a porch or workshop; though a little noisy for inside use. Speed variation from low to high is not enormous. The 10 year warranty says the company thinks well of its product. It is still all metal in a world of cheap plastic. We have 5 Patton fans and have never been disappointed. They are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: One Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this fan because in some reviews people were complaining about it being too loud. When I got in the mail I was surprised because it was loud at all. I would say it’s in the middle but my husband and I love sleeping with a fan so it was perfect for us. There are three settings and we don’t even have to go to the third setting because the first setting is already really strong and blows a very good amount of air and it’s very cooling. I highly recommend this fan if your looking for a decent size fan.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline bonfante

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, loud (expected) but effective
customer_reviews.text: I knew exactly what I was signing up for getting this fan. Face it, you cannot have a good metal fan without lots of noise! But I am used to it, and I dont mind the background noise, but boy did this do wonders. My roommate broke our heater button and it was stuck on during the summer, and I had to get this right away because I remembered having one as a kid. We would have to turn it off sometimes because it worked so well!
customer_reviews.author: Mell

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Really moves air well!
customer_reviews.text: This product over all is very good! We were impressed with the amount of air it moves. The 18' size for our need is MUCH better than a box fan. We have two wood stoves on either end of our 1800's home and because the rooms are so compartmentalized we needed a way to move the air through to the other rooms. This product works great for that job! My only wish (if I may have a wish, is to have a lower setting.) Currently the LOWEST setting on our Patton Fan moves air at a higher rate than our box fan on HIGH, and as much air as our previous floor fan on high.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Savelyev

customer_reviews.title: Not like Patton used to be
customer_reviews.text: This is not the Patton of years ago. This fan is not very High velocity. My old one was much more powerful and the cage was thicker depth than this new one. I know Patton is not what it used to be and the quality is definitely not there. It is OK but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette M. StoltzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: I had a large Patton fan that finally broke after so many years and I wanted the same one, which was basically this one, except black. It doesn’t make as loud of noise as the previous fan which for me who likes to fall asleep to the sound of my giant fan is not what I wanted but it still makes the obvious noise of a fan that I like so I’m not complaining. Great fan, circulates a lot of air!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Save the box because you will end up returning this fan!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this fan on May 17th and recieved it on the 21st. The fan is already done for. I only used it a handful of times. I tried multiple outlets and it won't turn on anymore. Now I'm gonna have to hassle with returning it. Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Barone

customer_reviews.title: Got used product, paid for BRAND NEW product.
customer_reviews.text: I received a used fan when I paid for a brand new fan. Zero stars, there are chips in the paint and dents all over it. Will be asking for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Poecist

customer_reviews.title: requires frequent oiling
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful fan, great for putting in a window facing out to exhaust hot air and bring in cool evening air from open windows on the opposite side of the house. BUT IT DRIPS OIL. The motor requires oiling on both front and rear bearings. A drop too much and it drips oil onto whatever surface it is sitting on. If you fail to oil it enough, the fan shaft won't turn. It would be okay in a workshop but gets messy in a home. but
customer_reviews.author: IBEW Yes!

customer_reviews.title: Overall good quality
customer_reviews.text: I will start off with the positives. It looks nice, easy to assemble, sounds great. There are no weird sounds to it. With that being said, I bought this fan for loud white noise to sleep. I had a similar fan that just died on me. So I bought the same style thinking I could expect the same air flow and sound. I borrowed my daughter's lasko box fan and there is little difference in sound or air flow. If I would have known that I would never spend 50 dollars on this fan. This patton 18" fan is fine, but nothing really different than a box fan other than the tilt feature.
customer_reviews.author: Tim fannin

customer_reviews.title: Not very "High Velocity"
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Patton Fans before and always been very satisfied. However this model is made cheaply and nowhere near the velocity they used to me. This model is very light weight in comparison. Definitely a cheaply made import - just may have purchased the "Patton" name to move them. Very unsatisfied !!
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Item received today, I plugged it in and it ran for approximately 5 minutes before it stopped working. I unplugged it from the outlet it was in and tried other outlets hoping that was the problem. Nope, just a faulty product, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Got knocked over by the dog, simple tipping over (it's already on the ground, so not a big fall) and the thing quit working. No visible damage and very light bump. Pretty bad quality if that breaks it. Otherwise I'd have given it a great rating, but I would NOT recommend it in light of the short lifespan. (We used it 4-5 nights/week for "white noise" - very large fan and good noise).
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 3 months and haven't been able to get the company to send a replacement .
customer_reviews.author: S. Mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me cool A+++
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these, one kind of died recently but it lasted around seven years where I was using it constantly in the summer/spring time. Admittedly the first one was about ten dollars cheaper than the second one. I'm being a bit more conservative now with the second one but it seems to have gotten a bit better. I highly recommend this as it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan - lasting durability
customer_reviews.text: We run this fan nightly. I works amazing. It gets slightly warm from the motor running all night but nothing bad. I use it for air circulation and white noise when we sleep and after 2 years - it still works great. I'm ordering another for my son's room. I most certainly recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap! The fan I received was obviously refurbished
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap! The fan I received was obviously refurbished. The box was damaged and had crappy tape holding the box together. Also the fan was repackaged upside down in the box. When I took the fan out it had scratches on the leg posts; but the biggest let down was how quiet and weak the air current was. I could barley tell a difference between low and high setting. I have tried several times to buy a fan on Amazon but each time I have to send it back. However this fan was the worst of them all in terms of quality, air current and noise (sounded like a whisper).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very high velocity
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't feel very high velocity to me. I have an older high velocity fan that's been discontinued and needed new fans because I'm moving into a new place. Couldn't find the same model so I settled on this Patton because of its reviews. I'm sad to say I am underwhelmed with my purchase. This Patton fan's highest speed feels more like the medium speed on my old fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ravyn

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Fan
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Patton fan as a replacement for another that we had had for at least 15 years. Used it nightly for 15 years I might add. However, this one lasted ONLY 3 MONTHS!. Went out in the middle of the night and just won't run. Also, the fan is much lighter and cheaper than the previous one. Recommend not buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for home use
customer_reviews.text: This fan is not up to the quality of other Patton products I've purchased. Having said that, it's of acceptable quality and performance, and would be a good fan for home use. It's relatively lightweight and has a good amount of power for moving air. We use it to move A/C in the house and have been quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: bearnorthwoods

customer_reviews.title: Functions Like Air King
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell it functions almost the same as Air King, just not the price point which is a plus! I have yet to open the electricals up yet the cord feels ok. It came UL rated and moves air (similarly to a comparable size of Air King). No major complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Siri

customer_reviews.title: Easy comfort
customer_reviews.text: Had a Patton for years. Glad I choose one again. Easy to carry and position where needed. Gives great reduction in heat in Had a Patton fan for years, so when it went out immediately bought this one. Easy to use and gives great breeze where needed. Mary C. Campbell
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Not quiet but not annoying. You’ll need to turn the tv louder than usual if your in a smaller space. Thought It would blow harder than it does but it’s doable for now.
customer_reviews.author: Talaya

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust but overall a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few months ago and still going strong. Fairly quiet while still moving a LOT of air. The thing I don't like is that there is no easy way to adjust the fans tilt. It's a bolt and nut style which require tools. Many fans I've purchased in the past have an easy to adjust lever and that's what I'd need to give this product 5 stars. Overall though, very nice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: Great powerful floor fan. The metal blades are so much more powerful than plastic. U definately get what u pay for majority of times..
customer_reviews.author: D. meadows

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use for my students in our cardio fitness class. It's perfect. Not noisy. My students are really happy with it and so am I!
customer_reviews.author: Granita

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot of air, even at the lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: Helps me to keep the AC setting lower in the sweltering months and evens out the room temperature in the colder months. Wish it had four settings rather than three, because a lower fan speed would probably work as well and make a little less noise
customer_reviews.author: bluiewest1

customer_reviews.title: Not really a high velocity fan
customer_reviews.text: I had a Patton fan for 20 years, bought this as a replacement and boy was I disappointed. This one has less than half the power and probably moves about a third of the air of the previous model. It is well constructed despite its county origin but the motor is not big enough to truly make this a high velocity fan. Compared to my old Patton, this moves less air on high speed than my old model moved on medium speed. I put this side by side with a cheap box fan from Lowes: the Patton has noticeably more air movement but not enough to justify the $50 price tag. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Patton Fans Were Built to Last /  Not Now !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Patton Fans for over 30 years and they have worked well, usually lasting 10 to 15 years... This product # PUF2010B-BM $75.74 is not a good fan... Very Loud, No ground on electric plug and difficult to maintain the level of adjustment for where you want the fan to blow... I will never own another Patton Fan !!! Jon Silverman Glassblowing
customer_reviews.author: R.JonSilverman

customer_reviews.title: I haven't turned it off in months
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this fan for over a year in my garage to keep airflow on my lumber, and keep me cool while working out, and it has been working phenomenally. This fan has been running on high for a few months now, and has yet to quit. I honestly can’t remember the last time I turned it off. It moves a lot of air very fast, and can push it far as well. It is quite loud, but for me that doesn’t matter since it’s in my garage. If/when my current one dies, I’ll just buy another. Definitely recommended, at least for outdoor or garage use.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: great fan but extremely loud
customer_reviews.text: This fan has very sturdy construction and great output for such a small build. However, it is rather loud. Scratch that. It is VERY loud. Even at the lowest setting it is loud with minimal change in volume at the higher speeds. It is great for circulating air when I'm working out but have found it just be too loud to use in the house on a daily basis. Would be great to cool garage or space where fan volume is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: It blows so much air for the size and noise it makes. You can have a normal conversation on a 16x32 deck with it blowing so much air right next to you or on the other side of deck or turn it to lower right next to you. Very satisfied. It would be even better if they used waterproof switch and motor but until then I take it in at night or tuck it under my camper awning.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Handshy

customer_reviews.title: put it on high u will feel like your going down the road in a convertible
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of them. I had them for a couple of years and never had a problem w/ them I will b buying another 1 next I can never have to much air at this price u can't beat it. put this fan on low u will get a lot of air, put it on high u will feel like your going down the road in a convertible. excellent fan
customer_reviews.author: JOHNNIE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is perfectly amazing! I love the frequency of sound it makes! Very soothing for my sensory disorder. And creates a large, very massive wind! Cools things down pretty quickly and powerfully
customer_reviews.author: KelcyMM

customer_reviews.title: Great product decent price just enough sound and tons of air movement
customer_reviews.text: My girls love the nice hum these bands put out. If the bands are too quiet it does not help them sleep if they're too loud they can't sleep. Perfect fan for the money plus plenty of air movement.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Schuster III

customer_reviews.title: The high speed is more like what you expect from a medium speed
customer_reviews.text: Ok fan. But no way they should be calling this high velocity. The high speed is more like what you expect from a medium speed. Is no more air than the cheap box fans.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: This fan is incredible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I went to college in September of 2017. My roommate and I had it running pretty much 24/7 for that entire year and it has been running in my room at home since then. Just today it finally crapped out on me after it fell off my desk but I would say that this fan had a lot more life if it hadn't fallen. This was such a great buy I immediately bought another one, if you want a fan that blows wel and isnt too too loud, this is the one for you. Trust me on that one.
customer_reviews.author: Julien Toulotte

customer_reviews.title: NYC Sweaty Summers
customer_reviews.text: This fan is a beast. I've had it for a while and it runs almost 24/7 in my apartment. I don't think I've ever put it on a higher speed than low. Moves the air around nicely and hasn't crapped out on me yet!
customer_reviews.author: chris piccione

customer_reviews.title: Air volume
customer_reviews.text: I like this fan for a small apt. area but not an excessively large room area. The air volume distribution is normal for what is needed. It is somewhat quiet...but one expects some noise due to the air flow not the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Patton will serve you well for many years.
customer_reviews.text: Patton Fans are everything you want when you need a fan. LOW setting is quiet enough and will create strong air movement in a large room. Faster settings are probably for drying out a flood or evacuating fumes from an area. It may not oscillate, but the airflow is so efficient that you can direct it away from you and still feel a breeze without continually being assaulted as the fan swings back towards you. This is my second Patton fan. My first was 25-30 years old, only 14", which I hand carried when I often moved in my younger years. This 18" Fan helps my wife and I circulate our A/C for more efficient cooling in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Wampage

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a WORKHORSE makes an incredible amount of noise at its lowest level, perfect for sleeping. It also whips the air around the room keeping temperatures very comfortable. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: It was detailed as being very loud and my goodness this did not disappoint! I use a fan to sleep and since ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan because of the reviews. It was detailed as being very loud and my goodness this did not disappoint! I use a fan to sleep and since I have an ever growing family, I had a lot to tune out and even on a low setting, it blocks out a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Padgett Ward

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fan!
customer_reviews.text: Love that there are the 3 speeds. We love to use this fan to sit outside in the summer, not only for the breeze, but it is definitely an eco-friendly way to keep mosquitoes away!
customer_reviews.author: snakes444

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heavy duty fan
customer_reviews.text: Great fan moves large volumes of air. I have run the fans 24/7 for days on end during hot weather to push the air conditioner cooled air around the house. I’ve purchased 3 fans now, they’re built to last.
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: Moves a LOT of air! Simple design features allows for easy set up and cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Moves a lot of air! Just what I needed to assist venting out a musty, stale smelling room. A bit loud on the highest setting. Assembly consisted of sliding the bottom support bar-stand piece onto the two side-uprights; handy tilt-adjustment feature. Other similar fans I've owned in the past were a real project to thoroughly clean when that time came. With this Patton fan I anticipate being very happy with the simple design- ability to very easily remove the front screen/grill from the back part via the small clips that keep the two together.
customer_reviews.author: Raphel

customer_reviews.title: Not
customer_reviews.text: This fan broke within the first 60 days. For all the reviews of 4 stars I have to say it is not. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: sierra bender

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan, an air circulator
customer_reviews.text: If you want to move air through the house, instead of just feel the air shift, this is the brand for you...We point ours facing out and suck the cool air from outside in. This is our 3rd Patton air circulator and the only brand we will buy. The last one we had lasted 13 years even after repeatedly falling from various window sills...So we replaced it with an 18" and a 14" and they are made even better these days.
customer_reviews.author: Lili J. Mcgovern

customer_reviews.title: Works Well. Not Noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the furbaby. He loves it. It stays outdoors on the covered porch and works well. Not as noisy as most people say in their reviews. Its a fan that works very well, so its going to make some noise. (Doesn't bother me when I'm sitting out there working from home and chiling with the Rottie) Perfect for what I needed it for. :) Have had it 2 years now.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyKid

customer_reviews.title: Not all that loud.  Pushes out a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: We were actually looking a loud fan for white noise, as I work nights sometimes. This wasn't really any louder than a cheap box fan. However, I will say this fan pushes A LOT of air and is adjustable, so we are keeping it for when hubby is working in the garage. We did try it one night in the bedroom.. but even on low, it pushed too much air.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Who needs a whole house fan when you have one of these?!
customer_reviews.text: Quite a powerful breeze, even on the low setting. I wish it had a longer cord. I live in an apartment complex where heat gets trapped when there's little to no wind. There's a 30 foot 'hallway', and the neighbor's A/C produces extra heat in the hot months, so in the evenings when it's cooler outside, the hallway remains too warm to open windows or a door on that side, so I put the fan just outside my open door, with windows from other sides of the apt open, and blow the hot air out of the hallway, drawing cooler air into my apt through the windows. I love this fan!
customer_reviews.author: pkeyrich

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Moves a huge amount of air compared to a box fan!! Suffered all last summer without Ac and a box fan. Still no ac this summer, but as long as this puppy was aimed towards me, I was fine.
customer_reviews.author: scienide

customer_reviews.title: fan
customer_reviews.text: It does circulate the air but I am use to the ones previously made that really put out the air and helps circulate the air . It is still better than the plastic fans. the motor dies on the old one and it was cheaper to buy a fan than to buy the motor.
customer_reviews.author: alicechatt

customer_reviews.title: BEST DEAL FOR THE $$
customer_reviews.text: I LOOKED ALL OVER AND FOUND THIS FAN. WE USE IT ON THE PATIO AND IN THE GARAGE/WORKSHOP. I READ MOST OF THE CUSTOMER REVIEWS, AND CAN ONLY CONCLUDE THAT I DON'T HAVE THE SAME GENERATION FAN. THE DETRACTORS COMPLAINED THAT EVEN ON THE LOWEST SPEED THE FAN WAS TOO HIGH SPEED AND NOISY! EVEN COMPARED TO AN AIRBOAT. HORSE FEATHERS. I WISH IT HAD AT LEAST ONE HIGHER SPEED, AND MY FAN IS QUIET AT ALL SPEEDS. MY FAN WAS WELL PACKED, CAME ON TIME, AND FULLY ASSEMBLED. I RATED IT DOWN TO FOUR STARS BECAUSE I WANTED THE AIRBOAT MODEL. PATTON MAKES VERY GOOD FANS.
customer_reviews.author: DAL PIONEER

customer_reviews.title: Patton fans are the very best.
customer_reviews.text: Patton has always made the best fans. Wish they had small 9-inch ones, as well, or desk type. We still use Patton fans that are probablly 35 years old and still going strong. They are the best. Will keep purchasing them for other rooms or for working on rentals, as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Magar

customer_reviews.title: Puts out a good amount of air
customer_reviews.text: The fan works very well. Puts out a good amount of air. It doesn't like to stay in the position you put it. I don't like the control switch on the back of the fan. We had to take pliers and smash the side attachment to keep it pointing in the direction I wanted. Otherwise it kept wanting to point up at the ceiling
customer_reviews.author: Karmel Prater

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fan
customer_reviews.text: You won't be disappointed. Excellent fan. Its powerful, and makes just enough noise, see, I like a fan that hums me to sleep. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Blade was not attached.
customer_reviews.text: The blade was not attached. I was inside the guard, along with the nut. I took off the front guard, attached the blade (guessing one of two possible orientations) tightened the left-handed nut to who-knows-what-torque, and hopefully I get eight years of vibration free use! Very noisy! The lowest setting is too fast. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Matt the shopper

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted the whole summer nearly on 100% of the time. I'm happy with my purchase. It is a bit on the louder side but its not that bad to me.
customer_reviews.author: T.Kuroda 天龍王

customer_reviews.title: MONEY WELL SPENT!
customer_reviews.text: This is an economical,very efficient air circulator. We placed it just in front of a floor A/C vent and tilted the fan upwards,or hassock position. This has kept our living room very comfortable and helps our central unit to cut off and on,on very hot days,which we certainly have in Arkansas. I am amazed at the low price and the fan circulator arrived well packaged and very quickly. It is not a super quiet operation,but a far better fan than the one we purchased before,for ALOT more money! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lew brown

customer_reviews.title: Good and does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and very strong even on low. Not as noisy as some claim here, but it is by no means whisper quiet. Snaps together super easily. I like it. It does the job. Probably would have bought the slightly bigger and $20 cheaper version if I could do it again. Great air circulator and I hope it will last a long while.
customer_reviews.author: MdW

customer_reviews.title: my cats love it because it makes the room so much more ...
customer_reviews.text: This fan is almost an air conditioner! It can freeze you out on low setting, even if it's pointed in the opposite direction! I'm not making this up, my cats love it because it makes the room so much more breathable, it's a must have. This is about ten times the amount of air moving from a regular box fan!, and that's on low speed! The whole reason for getting a fan is for rapid cooling, and this one will likely freeze you out quickly!
customer_reviews.author: steve chandler

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME POWER!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME power! We bought this because we are PATTON Fans - get it?! We have had our first Patton Fan for over 20 years and with this very HOT Summer decided we needed another one for the other side of the house. These are not like a 'run of the mill' fan. They are what they say - HIGH VELOCITY and for this heat that's what we need.
customer_reviews.author: Marin-Kit-Kat

customer_reviews.title: Strong Air Flow
customer_reviews.text: This is a good commercial fan that I use at home. It's more powerful than residential fans so a bit noisier, but when temps are unseasonably high and you have no air conditioning, noise is a small price to pay! Neighbors have come by and commented, they leave my place planning to order one for themselves. I paid extra to have the fan delivered next day - what a waste - it took two days anyway! Won't be doing that again!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.H. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, moves a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: Not as strong as the Patton I had in 1992. The brushes wore out and I was moving so chucked it. This fan is a great garage fan. Live in NC and summer is hot and humid.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Blows a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: This is the second fan I have bought (first one 2 years ago). The new fan has a slight vibration and will turn left, slowly but contentiously. I have to place a heavy weight on back of support leg to keep it in one place. 2 year old fan, same rubber feet etc... does not move and works great. Annoying I can't pick up the fan and move to another side of the shop when working without carrying weight around.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton E Etheridge

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Best fans in the world. We have used Patton fans for years, last forever. I have two chrome fans in garage that must be 20 years old plus.
customer_reviews.author: ejvwsc

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month and stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This fan worked pretty well until I went to turn it on after having it for a month and it wouldn't turn on. Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: It blows!
customer_reviews.text: This little fan really does move the air. I've used Patton fans for years. Typically, they're sturdy, dependable. So far, so has this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Fella

customer_reviews.title: Okay while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 20 inch version of this fan 2 years and 10 months ago. I have to agree with other reviewers, this version Made in China, is not the same as previous better quality Patton fans. It worked well for about 2 years. For the last 10 months, in spite of babying it with several cleanings and attempts at lubrication, it has gotten slower and slower, until last week when is stopped completely.
customer_reviews.author: Galuardi

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT your father's PATTON fan
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT your father's PATTON fan. I've bought PATTON fans in the past and they were as solid as the tank, and lasted just as long. This is either a cheap knockoff or worse, a cheap re-furb. With cheap plastic controls even. The fan started to rattle and grind right after I bought it, but not before the return period expired. NOT MADE IN AMERICA. Be Nancy Reagan. JUST SAY NO.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Michael Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Good fan. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good fan for the price. Used it in the shop for two days so far and it’s been working good. No problems. I was hesitant to buy one from some of the other reviews, however I’m happy I ordered one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric & Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to the older Patton fans.
customer_reviews.text: It’s really sad what’s happened to this company, they used to make such a great product, now...meh..sub-par. If you’ve never owned an older Patton fan then you’ll probably be satisfied with this one. The high setting on this fan puts out about the same air as the low setting on my 12 yr old Patton🙁
customer_reviews.author: Chad Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy, Wimpy, Wimpy
customer_reviews.text: Not what I had expected of Patton. Bought this fan to replace it's 30 year-old twin, only to find it has less than half the power output. (New patton fan motor pulls 1.25 amps of power vs. 4 amp motor in old Patton fan). The difference in fan output is very dramatic. That won't cut it for my needs. Returning this fan and moving on...
customer_reviews.author: Phlabberghast!

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I had a Patton and loved it, that thing was great and could really moves some air. It finally died after 3 or 4 years of heavy use. I ran it all night in my bedroom as I like some air circulation and the noise. This one at first I thought I was on speed 1 and it was on 3 (high). Hopefully it will make the grade like the Patton of past.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Super Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this fan, it is very powerful, and easy to move around, a plus children cant hurt their fingers on (great saefty).
customer_reviews.author: My Mother Ship

customer_reviews.title: This is not my first Patton fan. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Patton fan. I have a 14 inch version purchased 10 years ago, still going strong. The 18 inch version is much stronger and louder. Even on low, it blows a lot. Probably not something for the bedroom, too noisy. If you want to move a lot of air in a large area this is the fan for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tapnavillus

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years Before Motor Bearings Failed but Replaced Under Warranty - Very Pleased With Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Patton PUF 1410B 14 inch fan at the end of May 2014 and today (9 June 2016) the motor bearings seized up. I would have expected a lot more than 2 years of light use out of this fan. I have USA made Patton fans from the 90's that are still going but unfortunately this Chinese made item isn't up to the task. I have tried to lubricate the motor bearing but unfortunately it hasn't helped. P.S. If you follow this thread, you will see that Patton have agreed to send me a replacement fan. i am very pleased with their customer service and have given them 5 stars for looking after me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy Powerful Fan
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the quality of this fan. Its sturdy and has the ability to be pretty powerful, much better than the ugly plastic box fans. I use this fan for sleeping every night on its lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than I thought it would be!
customer_reviews.text: Although the metal grating that contains the bladed part of the fan was dented in slightly upon arrival, I decided to keep it anyway to avoid the hassle of the exchange process. It poses no problem to me anyways, just a slight eyesore. I'm glad I kept it, because now I am living my best life in subzero temperatures!
customer_reviews.author: Wren A.

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job at moving the air
customer_reviews.text: Look it's a big fan. I use it to move the air in the house with 20 ft ceilings. Yes, on the higher setting it is loud, but it does the job. I set it on low when the AC is on. It's a great fan.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The little black box in the back was hot to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's been on continually for over a year and not one complaint from me or the fan!
customer_reviews.author: The Grunaus

customer_reviews.title: Really powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and first impression is AWESOME!! I needed a floor fan for indoor cycling where it can get really hot! This is exactly what I was looking for. I can rotate it to the exact position. Even on the lowest setting it is quite powerful. Noise level is low too.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Is good air blowie. You buy too.
customer_reviews.text: Is air blowie. Blowie air nice and good. Make you not hot. Is good not be hot. You buy blowie, you not be hot. You happy like me.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: moves the air
customer_reviews.text: We use this one for the living room. It has a little noise to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue.

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: I use outside in texas on the coast. Has held up great so far. Small amount of rust but i live by the water. No slow speed, fast, faster, and fastest. Wish it had a slower speed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality excellent air mover
customer_reviews.text: Other than the noise, these fans are well worth the purchase. Wasted too much money buying cheap or so called higher end pedestal fans! Our 4 dogs want cool comfort in summer, these are well built, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MSMisBS

customer_reviews.title: Well built, quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality fan that really moves the air. Great for cooling off a hot garage or large space. Patton is the best name in the fan industry for a reason, their products are well made and last a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: 👁👄👁 Its AJ

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase and awesome fan. It was a huge help during time our air conditioner was out. I'd definitely order again
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: Good fan good price
customer_reviews.text: We mounted these to the wall in our garage. Great to keep the air moving
customer_reviews.author: Ecarr

customer_reviews.title: Cools room
customer_reviews.text: Patton metal fans the best. Lasts for years almost 12 years
customer_reviews.author: sabrina burnshartsfield

customer_reviews.title: Great garage fan
customer_reviews.text: Very robust airflow and it's well built. Got a great deal from the Amazon warehouse, box was damaged but fan was intact and came looking brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Patton Fan
customer_reviews.text: I had another Patton fan for over 20 years that this one replaced. I use it to circulate air from a cool basement up to a room one floor above. It moves enough cool air to change the temperature 2-3 degrees in the room above. Then I can keep the air conditioner at a higher temperature. I have owned two other Patton fans and been really satisfied with them. I love that they last for 20 years plus with little or no maintenance. A product that you can depend on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Musil

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BARN AND HOUSE FAN! MOVES AIR!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A great barn fan for cows and horses both! They work good in the milk parlor and also on horse stalls. No one in the barn complains about the noise they make. We do have two we use in the house and consider the little bit of noise they make no problem. We consider that a minor thing and worth it for the amount of air they move. This is a great fan for any where.
customer_reviews.author: Gemludy

product_meta.title: Patton PUF1810C-BM 18-Inch High Velocity Fan,Black
product_meta.description: Size:18-InchThe Patton High Velocity Fan features a powerful motor and a large blade diameter to move air effectively in any home or work environment. This heavy-duty fan has three speed settings that allow you to maximize air intake, air exhaust, and air circulation and a tilt-adjustable head for precise air movement. Great for cooling, ventilation, and drying tasks in garages and workshops, the Patton High Velocity Fan has a durable powder-coated metal construction for reliable, long-lasting use in demanding work areas.
feature_bullets: Powerful motor with large blade diameters designed to move lots of air
Metal construction built tough to withstand the harsh environment of the work shop
Tilt adjustable head allows you to focus airflow where you need it
It is ideal for garages and workshops for cooling, ventilation or drying

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,569 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
